intro: Geanthus versteegii, commonly known as the African bellflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. It has small, lance-shaped leaves and produces showy, clustered blooms during the spring and summer months. Geanthus versteegii is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and botanical collections.
